photo.description: The view from the courtyard, looking at the arcades of the Palas (Great Hall. Galleries are built onto the west side of all three stories of the Palas, facing the inner bailey. The arcades, with abundant column ornamentation, were principally built to satisfy the building sponsor's aesthetic requirements. www.wartburg-eisenach.de/frame_sn.htm

photo.title: Wartburg Mosaic

photo.description: Wartburg Castle. Located between Frankfurt and Berlin at Eisenach, and perched on a hill, this is where Martin Luther stayed from May 1521 until March 1522. The large tower in the middle is the Castle Keep, and was finished in 1859. Its base partially includes the foundation of its medieval predecessor. One of the castle's landmarks-the four-meter tall Latin cross-is located at the top of the keep and is visible from afar. www.wartburg-eisenach.de/frame_sn.htm
photo.tags: wartburg germany thüringer thuringia castle castles eisenach martinluther luther keep castlekeep golddragon goldstaraward amazingshot magiceye awardwinner aclass bachspicsgallery excapture othervillage worldpicture worldwidewandering www 500 views 1000 amazingamateur medieval ancient old history historical interesting masterpiece stone engineering 5photosaday worldtrekker
photo.title: Wartburg Castle

photo.description: Wartburg castle, Martin Luthers room and writing desk. Note the painting above the desk.
photo.tags: wartburg germany thüringer thuringia castle castles eisenach martinluther luther keep cabinetry carving desk chair book old history religion woodwalls lutheran bible painting antique brown room reflection contemplation historical writing father monk medieval
photo.title: He Wrote A Lot

photo.description: Wartburg castle, located between Frankfurt and Berlin, Germany. For a brief time the home of Martin Luther. His time at the Wartburg was a very productive period in his career. During this period of exile, Luther translated the New Testament from Greek into German. It was printed in September 1522. The long white with brown wood detailing structure at the top of the wall is The Elizabeth Hallway. By help of wooden consoles, which supported projecting beams, the original ring wall was overbuilt with a closed defence circuit in the 15th century. www.wartburg-eisenach.de/frame_sn.htm
photo.tags: wartburg germany thüringer thuringia castle castles eisenach martinluther luther elizabethhallway wall aplusphoto
photo.title: Wartburg Castle

photo.description: The Elizabeth Bower Room contains beautiful mosaics of depicting scenes from the life of Saint Elizabeth. Wartburg Castle, Germany.
photo.tags: wartburg germany thüringer thuringia castle castles eisenach martinluther luther keep elizabethbower stelizabeth saintelizabeth elizabeth mosaic mosaics ceiling art 200 views medieval ancient old history historical interesting masterpiece stone engineering
photo.title: Wartburg Mosaic

photo.description: Die Wartburg ist eine Burg in Thüringen, über der Stadt Eisenach am nordwestlichen Ende des Thüringer Waldes gelegen, 411 m ü. NN. Sie wurde um 1067 von Ludwig dem Springer gegründet und gehört seit 1999 zum Weltkulturerbe. The Wartburg is a castle situated on a 1230-foot (410 m) precipice to the southwest of, and overlooking the town of Eisenach, in the state of Thuringia, Germany. In 1999 UNESCO added Wartburg Castle to the World Heritage List as an "Outstanding Monument of the Feudal Period in Central Europe", citing its "Cultural Values of Universal Significance"
photo.tags: wartburg burg thüringen deutschland eisenach castle thuringia germany predigital 35mm scan scanned matthias sandra andreas andrea film
photo.title: Die Wartburg bei Eisenach

photo.description: Dieser Süd- oder Pulverturm auf der Ecke des Burghofs stammt wahrscheinlich aus dem 14. Jahrhundert und war zum Zeitpunkt unseres Besuchs leider geschlossen. In ihm befindet sich auch ein Gefangenenverlies.
photo.tags: deutschland germany thüringen eisenach wartburg burg südturm pulverturm turm tower castle tour latorre châteaufort elcastillo torre
photo.title: Wartburg am 25.03.2008 (19).jpg

photo.description: Die Außenfassade des Palas. Es ist wohl nicht ganz klar, ob das Gebäude ursprünglich so errichtet wurde, oder ob die oberste Etage erst später hinzugefügt wurde. In dieser befindet sich ein großer Festsaal, in dem in heutiger Zeit Konzerte veranstaltet werden.
photo.tags: deutschland germany thüringen eisenach wartburg burg castle châteaufort elcastillo
photo.title: Wartburg am 25.03.2008 (22).jpg

photo.description: Fotografie der Wartburg bei Schneefall am 25.03.2008. Trotzdem ist die Architektur der Burg wie sie sich heute präsentiert gut erkennbar. Der überragende Bergfried stammt allerdings erst aus dem 19. Jahrhundert.
photo.tags: deutschland germany thüringen eisenach wartburg burg bergfried turm tower castle tour latorre châteaufort elcastillo torre

photo.title: Wartburg am 25.03.2008 (20).jpg

photo.description: Die Möbel im Speisesaal sind erst ca. 150 Jahre alt. Es ist auch nicht ganz sicher ob dies wirklich im ursprünglichen Konzept des Gebäudes auch der Speisesaal war. Die Holzdecke (riesige Eichenbalken, Kernholz) ist orginal aus dem 12. Jahrhundert. Das beweist, dass die damaligen Bauleute schon sehr genau wußten was sie taten.

photo.description: Dieses Bild zeigt die eigentliche Hofburg (oder das was von ihr übrig ist). Rechts das Gadem, in der Mitte das Torhaus, der Bergfried mit dem goldenen Kreuz auf dem Dach und links die Fassade des Palas aus dem 12. Jahrhundert.

photo.description: Dieses riesige Gemälde zeigt die Sage vom Sängerkrieg und ist im Sängersaal zu betrachten. Es wurde im 19. Jahrhunder von Moritz von Schwind gemalt. Er hat dabei viele Proträts berühmter Dichter aus seiner Zeit eingearbeitet.

photo.description: 15.4.2009: despite what Luther thought, the desire to visit 'holy' sites seems to be an ineradicable human impulse. photo.description: The Festival Hall extends over the entire length and width of the Palas. The impressive dimensions and ornate decoration has made it one of the best examples of the historistic art interpretations. The Bavarian "fairy king," Ludwig II, planned an exact imitation of the Festival Hall at the Neuschwanstein Castle. The excellent acoustics of the Festival Hall make it one of the most favoured concert halls in Germany and a popular place for other events, including the annual presentation of the Wartburg Prize.

photo.title: The Festival Hall (Grand Hall)

photo.description: The Suedturm or the South Tower, is the only preserved tower of the medieval castle was erected after 1318. Halfway up the tower is the entrance to the dungeon, where prisoners were kept. www.wartburg-eisenach.de/frame_sn.htm

photo.title: Windows Make the Best Frames

photo.description: At the beginning of the 13th century, the most well-known singers and poets were invited by the Thuringian landgrave to stay at the Wartburg. At this time, the Wartburg was one of Europe's most famous art cultivation centres. Therefore the Legend of the Minnesingers' Contest has a proven historical background. The legend is depicted on a magnificent fresco by Moritz von Schwind and is well known from the world-famous Wagner opera "Tannhäuser." The singers' gallery represents the Romantics' imagination of the minnesingers' stage.
photo.tags: wartburg germany thüringer thuringia castle castles eisenach martinluther luther keep tapestry art singershall minnesingers vonschwind 100 views
photo.title: The Singers Hall

photo.description: A fire destroyed the original Wartburg chapel and a sacred room was later built into the Palas. The only remains from the original room déecor are part of a mural, painted around 1300. During the summer months, organ concerts and holy services are still held at the chapel.
photo.tags: wartburg germany thüringer thuringia castle castles eisenach martinluther luther keep ceiling art fresco chapel
photo.title: Wartburg Chapel

photo.description: In one of the arcades, a cover stone for a knight's tomb. www.wartburg-eisenach.de/frame_sn.htm
photo.tags: wartburg germany thüringer thuringia castle castles eisenach martinluther luther keep palas greathall coverstone tomb knight effigy stonework 100 views
photo.title: Wartburg Knight

photo.description: An ornate category of the Wartburg Castle stock is the historic cutlery collection of Baron Gottfried von und zu Egloffstein. In 1843 it became the property of the Grand Duke. Magnificent 16th century cutlery crafted from different exquisite materials will please your eye. The great variety and elegance of these "functional tools" will fill every visitor with enthusiasm, whether it is Italian cutlery made of mother of pearl or German pieces which shine in different colours of enamel.
photo.tags: wartburg germany thüringer thuringia castle castles eisenach martinluther luther keep cutlery egloffstein
photo.title: Egloffstein Historical Cutlery Collection
